thread.title: New York Mets fan brought to tears on WFAN over Chase Utley situation
thread.title_full: New York Mets fan brought to tears on WFAN over Chase Utley situation | syracuse.com

author: Brent Axe | baxe@syracuse.com
title: New York Mets fan brought to tears on WFAN over Chase Utley situation
text:
As Tom Hanks once told us , 'there is no crying in baseball.'
But apparently crying while talking about baseball on the radio is allowed.
WFAN host Mike Francesa took a call from a listener on Sunday morning about the Chase Utley slide that took New York Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada out of Game 2 of the NLDS with the Los Angeles Dodgers with a broken leg.
Utley has been suspended for two games for the play .
"Will in Queens" decided to vent his frustration to Francesa and it wasn't long before the tears started flowing.
"I would say it's dirty," Will said of the Utley slide as he started to break up. "(Matt) Harvey better step up tomorrow night. I'm disgusted with him, but this is his one chance to put the team on his shoulders then you have my faith back."
Will had made his point and then hung up.
Francesa was surprised at the emotion in his voice and didn't exactly lend a comforting shoulder for Will to lean on after the call.
"Will, are you crying," Francesa asked. "You're not really crying over this I hope."
You can hear the exchange below.
Game 3 of the NLDS is Monday night at CitiField in New York. The series is tied at 1-1. First pitch is at 8:30 p.m.
Here's hoping you can call Francesa on Tuesday with tears of joy in your eyes this time, Will.
